title: European Parliament Elections 2024
text:
Methodology
In collaboration with Who Targets Me, we monitored 170 political advertisers to better understand how campaigns use different targeting methods made available by Meta. To do this, we used data from the Meta Ad Library, using the new â€˜Audienceâ€™ data which gives some detail on how pages target their ads.
To better understand the election, we kept only advertisers who:

Advertised in the last 7 days (28 May - 3 Jun 2024)
Advertised in the last 30 days (5 May - 3 Jun 2024)







Note



Meta only provides 7, 30 and 90 days windows for the targeting data in their Ad Library. Metaâ€™s data also lags by a few days. Report will be updated as soon as new data is available.








Disclaimer



The data shown in this dashboard is based on the platformâ€™s respective ad libraries which are known to be sometimes incomplete (Edelson et al.Â 2020; Silva et al.Â 2020). For this reason the data shown here might not reflect the full picture nor all political ads that were targeted at voters.




About the Creator of the Dashboard











Fabio Votta is a Postdoc at the University of Amsterdam who studies (online) political microtargeting and its usage around the world.














  BlueSky
  Twitter
  Personal Website









Want to see how political parties target you? Sign up at Who Targets Me and download the gratis browser plugin to see how parties on Facebook use your data:
https://whotargets.me/







Want to retrieve targeting data from the Facebook Ad Library yourself? This dashboard is powered by the R package: metatargetr. Check it out here:
https://github.com/favstats/metatargetr




Election Targeting Dashboards

title: Spending per Targeting
text:
These charts show the groups that political parties target with their advertisements leading up to the elections, according to the latest data. The focus is on Metaâ€™s platforms (Facebook and Instagram) because they offer the most detailed targeting options for political advertisements.
How much did the campaigns of political parties spend on different audiences? The charts below show both the total and the expenditures per party.

Note: Different targeting criteria may overlap, so the outcome may not necessarily add up to 100%.


5 May - 3 Jun 202428 May - 3 Jun 2024



TotalBy Party




























































TotalBy Party
